bibl.title: Chin Hing v. United States of America
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US District Court Western Division of Washington, Seattle

p.add: U.S. Immigration Service Received Nov 24 1914 Seattle, Wash.

div1.p: In response to your telegram of the 19th instant, the Bureau incloses a certified copy of the memorandum, dated September 22, 1914, and of the digest of evidence in the case of Chin Hing attached to such memorandum, with which the said case was submitted to the Acting Secretary, and on which memorandum the Acting Secretary, under date of September 25, 1914, wrote "approved", signing his ititals "J.B.D." Under date of November 13, the said memorandum and digest, together with the entire record, were submitted to the Secretary of Labor, and after carefully considering the case, he wrote on the memorandum, as you will see from the certified copy, "approved", signing his initials "W.B.W."

As your telegram indicates that what is desired is a certified paper shoing the Department's final action, it is believed that the inclosed will serve your purpose, without withdrawing from the Bureau's files the entire record, of which you already possess a complete copy with the exception of the notation on the memorandum of the Secretary' approval.
